de.samdev.absgdx.framework.map.mapscaleresolver

Class SectionMapScaleResolver

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.samdev.absgdx.framework.map.mapscaleresolver.MinimumBoundaryMapScaleResolver
      • de.samdev.absgdx.framework.map.mapscaleresolver.LimitedMinimumBoundaryMapScaleResolver
        • de.samdev.absgdx.framework.map.mapscaleresolver.SectionMapScaleResolver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AbstractMapScaleResolver

    public class SectionMapScaleResolver
extends LimitedMinimumBoundaryMapScaleResolver
    This MapScaleResolver is an extension to the LimitedMinimumBoundaryMapScaleResolver. Additional to the maximum cut amount (from LimitedMinimumBoundaryMapScaleResolver) this becomes a minimum tile size This is a MinimumMapScaleResolver with an additional upper and lower limit for the tile size

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class de.samdev.absgdx.framework.map.mapscaleresolver.MinimumBoundaryMapScaleResolver

        tilesX, tilesY

    • Constructor Detail

      • SectionMapScaleResolver

        public SectionMapScaleResolver(int visibleTilesX,
                       int visibleTilesY,
                       float maximumCutPrecentage,
                       float minimumTileSize)
        Creates a new SectionMapScaleResolver
        Parameters:
        visibleTilesX - the width of the boundary box
        visibleTilesY - the height of the boundary box
        maximumCutPrecentage - the maximum amount of "cut away" tiles
        minimumTileSize - the minimum size for the tiles

    • Method Detail

      • getTileSize

        public float getTileSize(int screenWidth,
                int screenHeight,
                int mapWidth,
                int mapHeight)
        Specified by:
        getTileSize in interface AbstractMapScaleResolver
        Overrides:
        getTileSize in class LimitedMinimumBoundaryMapScaleResolver
        Parameters:
        screenWidth - The width of the screen
        screenHeight - The height of the screen
        mapWidth - the map width (in tiles)
        mapHeight - the map height (in tiles)
        Returns:
        the size of a single tile (width == height)
